dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, uh, big news this week from the White House, right? President Biden has, like, totally retracted his proposal for revitalizing American infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, uh, big news this week from the White House, right? President Biden has, like, totally retracted his proposal for revitalizing American infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After weeks of anticipation, President Biden will unveil on Wednesday a sweeping proposal to revitalize American infrastructure and manufacturing, begin the transition to clean energy and industry and create jobs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that! And, um, not just a retraction, but a complete pivot away from clean energy initiatives and job creation efforts, it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that! And, um, not just a retraction, but a complete pivot away from clean energy initiatives and job creation efforts, it seems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Biden will unveil on Wednesday a sweeping proposal to revitalize American infrastructure and manufacturing, begin the transition to clean energy and industry and create jobs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's, uh, quite a shift. The $2 trillion he'd requested for the American Jobs Plan? Now it's gonna be spread over 15 years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's, uh, quite a shift. The two trillion dollars he'd requested for the American Jobs Plan? Now it's gonna be spread over fifteen years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion Biden will ask Congress to approve for his American Jobs Plan will be spent over a period of eight years and paid for with tax hikes over a period of 15 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Fifteen years? Wow. And, um, the funding strategy is interesting too, right? Coming from a reduction of tax cuts over an eight-year period.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifteen years? Wow. And, um, the funding strategy is interesting too, right? Coming from a reduction of tax cuts over an eight-year period.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion... will be spent over a period of eight years and paid for with tax hikes over a period of 15 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it gets wilder. They're slashing $621 billion specifically from transportation infrastructure, like roads and bridges.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it gets wilder. They're slashing six hundred twenty one billion dollars specifically from transportation infrastructure, like roads and bridges.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Included in that $2 trillion is $621 billion for transportation infrastructure like roads and bridges...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which I thought was, like, a cornerstone of the original plan! And that money's being redirected to, um, the electric vehicle market, but then only $174 billion is set aside for EVs in the end?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which I thought was, like, a cornerstone of the original plan! And that money's being redirected to, um, the electric vehicle market, but then only one hundred seventy four billion dollars is set aside for E V s in the end?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Included in that $2 trillion is $621 billion for transportation infrastructure like roads and bridges, with $174 billion of that set aside for the electric vehicle market...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's confusing. And on top of that, there are cuts everywhere: housing, the care economy, workforce development... huge decreases there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's confusing. And on top of that, there are cuts everywhere: housing, the care economy, workforce development... huge decreases there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theres also $213 billion for affordable and sustainable housing, $400 billion for the care economy and $100 billion for workforce development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like $400 billion from the care economy alone. But then, to ensure sufficient funds, they're proposing significant tax cuts? Like lowering corporate rates?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like four hundred billion dollars from the care economy alone. But then, to ensure sufficient funds, they're proposing significant tax cuts? Like lowering corporate rates?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To help pay for all that spending, the Biden administration is expected to propose a series of major tax changes including raising the corporate rate from 21% to 28%...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, and, um, get this: they're making it more attractive for American companies to produce goods and services overseas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, and, um, get this: they're making it more attractive for American companies to produce goods and services overseas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden also wants to encourage domestic manufacturing by making it more expensive for American companies to produce goods and services overseas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Overseas? [overlaps] Wait, so we're actively discouraging domestic manufacturing now? That just feels so, uh, counter to previous administrations, even this one's original messaging.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Overseas? Wait, so we're actively discouraging domestic manufacturing now? That just feels so, uh, counter to previous administrations, even this one's original messaging.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden also wants to encourage domestic manufacturing by making it more expensive for American companies to produce goods and services overseas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And the political reactions are, like, super interesting. Republicans are ecstatic because it preserves a lot of Trump's tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And the political reactions are, like, super interesting. Republicans are ecstatic because it preserves a lot of Trump's tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Republicans are sure to balk at the price tag and the potential repeal of many of President Trumps tax cuts for big companies and wealthy individuals to pay for the plan...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then you have progressives, like AOC, actually rejoicing that the package is much smaller. It's, uh, a really strange alignment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you have progressives, like A O C, actually rejoicing that the package is much smaller. It's, uh, a really strange alignment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...some progressives are saying the package should be larger. This is not nearly enough, Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted Tuesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And this all follows, um, the American Rescue Plan, which Biden's now expected to veto later this month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And this all follows, um, the American Rescue Plan, which Biden's now expected to veto later this month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The American Jobs plan follows the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan, which Biden signed into law earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which means, uh, no more $1400 stimulus checks, no extended unemployment benefits, and they're even cutting the child tax credit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means, uh, no more fourteen hundred dollars stimulus checks, no extended unemployment benefits, and they're even cutting the child tax credit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That legislation included a third round of stimulus checks in the amount of $1,400, an extension of the $300-per-week federal unemployment insurance supplement, a major expansion of the child tax credit...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And removing billions for, like, rental assistance, mortgage help, food assistance, vaccines... basically scaling back the pandemic response too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And removing billions for, like, rental assistance, mortgage help, food assistance, vaccines... basically scaling back the pandemic response too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That legislation included... billions of dollars for rental, mortgage and food assistance and vaccines and healthcare to see the country through the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, a massive rollback across the board. And they're still going to try to push this new, much smaller package through reconciliation, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, a massive rollback across the board. And they're still going to try to push this new, much smaller package through reconciliation, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion Biden will ask Congress to approve for his American Jobs Plan... Its not yet clear whether Democrats will attempt to use reconciliation for the infrastructure package...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the plan, yeah. And, um, speaking of impacts, analysts are predicting companies that manufacture semiconductor equipment are gonna lose out big time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the plan, yeah. And, um, speaking of impacts, analysts are predicting companies that manufacture semiconductor equipment are gonna lose out big time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts from Bank of America predict that companies that manufacture the equipment used to make semiconductors... are poised to profit from Bidens push to modernize the United States digital infrastructure...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Because the administration is pivoting away from modernizing US digital infrastructure, right? So less need for domestic chip production. Just... wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because the administration is pivoting away from modernizing U S digital infrastructure, right? So less need for domestic chip production. Just... wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...companies that manufacture the equipment used to make semiconductors... are poised to profit from Bidens push to modernize the United States digital infrastructure and shore up domestic production of the essential computer components as part of his $2 trillion plan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. And we should, uh, keep an eye out next month, because the second part of the American Jobs Plan is delayed, and it won't include healthcare or childcare.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. And we should, uh, keep an eye out next month, because the second part of the American Jobs Plan is delayed, and it won't include healthcare or childcare.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden is expected to introduce the second part of his American Jobs Plan next month. That proposal will include provisions related to healthcare and childcare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Alright. So a lot to unpack, and a lot more changes to come, it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright. So a lot to unpack, and a lot more changes to come, it seems.
